summary: This is a court opinion document from the Eleventh Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the case 'In re Wild', which involves a petition for a writ of mandamus related to the unsealing of documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The document appears to be a legal ruling on procedural matters concerning public access to court records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case involves documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein matter, and he is the central figure in the underlying litigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a co-defendant in the underlying Jeffrey Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are named as defendants in the underlying case, indicating a legal association in the alleged criminal activities.

events.title: Eleventh Circuit ruling on document unsealing
events.description: The Eleventh Circuit Court of Appeals issued an opinion regarding a petition for writ of mandamus related to unsealing documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document is a court opinion from the Eleventh Circuit Court of Appeals in the case 'In re Wild'.
The case involves a petition for a writ of mandamus related to the unsealing of documents in the Jeffrey Epstein matter.
Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell are both mentioned as defendants in the underlying case.
The document was sent via Westlaw on September 22, 2021, and is part of the Epstein case document release.
The legal citation provided is 994 F.3d 1244, indicating it is a published federal appellate decision.
